thread.title: What you missed at Portland's FashioNXT (67 runway photos)
thread.title_full: What you missed at Portland's FashioNXT (67 runway photos) | OregonLive.com

author: Anna Marum | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: What you missed at Portland's FashioNXT (67 runway photos)
text:
Portland's third-annual FashioNXT show, which ran four days, featured something for everyone in the past week: international designers shared the stage with homegrown Project Runway stars, and children and adult models alike walked the runway.
A pair of design competitions included one for wearable technology (snagged by Essere for its customizable garments ), and one for emerging designers ( won by German Madrigal with its gender-neutral, futuristic designs).
On the show's second night, FashioNXT founder and executive producer Prasenjit "Tito" Chowdhury said he was pleased with the event's attendance, which continued to grow. His favorite parts of the show, he said, were the wearable technology contest and the 15-month-long accelerator program for emerging designers.
"It's all about developing an ecosystem collaboratively, so the fashion industry can grow in Portland," he said.
Portland first lady Nancy Hales – a vocal supporter of the local fashion industry – was also in attendance, wearing a gauzy maxi skirt by Portland designer Britt Howard .
"This is Portland's future," she said. "These designers and innovators are part of that next economy."
-- Anna Marum
